justification: The data clump with key 0 has a large number of common fields between two classes, which indicates a significant amount of duplicated data structure. This can lead to bloated code, increased risk of errors when making changes, and difficulties in maintaining the code. By refactoring this data clump, we can encapsulate the common fields into a single class, which can then be reused across the two classes, reducing duplication and improving maintainability.
